item.title: 中国计划在财政刺激政策中降低购房税
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，随着政府加大财政支持力度以重振奄奄一息的房地产市场，中国正计划削减购房税费。【原文：China is planning to cut taxes for home purchases as the government dials up fiscal support to revive a moribund housing market, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 在特朗普和宏观经济威胁下，中国科技股需要盈利提振
item.description: 在国内宏观前景不明和地缘政治风险上升导致中国科技股迅速降温之后，投资者正期待本周发布的主要财报带来第二春。【原文：After a rapid cooling in Chinese tech stocks on cloudy domestic macro prospects and rising geopolitical risk, investors are looking to major earnings reports due this week for a second wind.】

item.title: 季度利润下降，韩国锌业对股票出售保持沉默
item.description: 韩国锌业公司（Korea Zinc Co.）周二报告第三季度营业利润下降，但没有向投资者提供其计划出售 18 亿美元股票的最新情况，该计划已受到韩国金融监督机构的调查。【原文：Korea Zinc Co. reported a drop in third-quarter operating profit on Tuesday but stopped short of providing investors with a much-anticipated update on its planned $1.8 billion share sale, already under investigation by the country’s financial watchdog.】

item.title: 艾芬豪的弗里德兰称美国关税对中国的影响被过度夸大
item.description: 艾芬豪矿业有限公司（Ivanhoe Mines Ltd.）创始人罗伯特-弗里德兰（Robert Friedland）表示，自唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）首次执政以来，中国减少了对美国经济的投资，使其能够更好地抵御当选总统承诺的惩罚性贸易关税。【原文：China has reduced its exposure to the US economy since Donald Trump’s first administration, leaving it better placed to weather the punitive trade tariffs being pledged by the president-elect, according to Robert Friedland, the founder of Ivanhoe Mines Ltd.】

item.title: PE 支持的监狱医疗保健公司 Wellpath 宣布破产
item.description: Wellpath Holdings Inc.是为全美监狱和看守所提供医疗保健服务的最大供应商之一，该公司因无力偿还债务，同时还要应对高昂的劳动力成本而申请破产。【原文：Wellpath Holdings Inc., one of the largest providers of health-care services to prisons and jails across the US, has filed bankruptcy after failing to meet its debt obligations while grappling with high labor costs.】

item.title: 特朗普胜选后美元反弹，黄金维持在一个月低点附近
item.description: 由于唐纳德-特朗普赢得总统大选进一步提振了美元，黄金在周一暴跌后维持在一个月低点附近。【原文：Gold held near a one-month low after tumbling on Monday as Donald Trump’s presidential win boosted the dollar further.】

item.title: 初创企业行业萎靡不振，印尼独资风险投资公司募集较小规模基金
item.description: 印度尼西亚风险投资公司 Intudo Ventures 为其第四期基金募集了 7500 万美元，随着东南亚初创企业行业的萎缩，该公司的规模较上一期基金有所缩小。【原文：Intudo Ventures, an Indonesian venture capital firm, raised $75 million for its fourth fund, downsizing from its previous one as Southeast Asia’s startup industry shrinks.】

item.title: Shopify、Slack 创始人加入 Thiel 的 Valar 公司，支持金融科技公司 Neo Financial
item.description: Shopify Inc.和 Slack Technologies Inc.的创始人加入了彼得-蒂尔的风险投资公司，为一家向加拿大人提供信用卡、抵押贷款和储蓄账户的金融技术公司进行一轮融资。【原文：The founders of Shopify Inc. and Slack Technologies Inc. joined Peter Thiel’s venture firm in a fundraising round for a financial technology company that offers credit cards, mortgages and savings accounts to Canadians.】

item.title: 比特币创纪录，加密货币市值突破大流行时期峰值
item.description: 比特币破纪录的涨势使该数字资产突破了 89,000 美元，并使加密货币市场的整体价值超过了大流行病时期的峰值，因为交易商押注当选总统唐纳德-特朗普执政后的繁荣。【原文：Bitcoin’s record-breaking rally took the digital asset past $89,000 and lifted the overall value of the crypto market above its pandemic-era peak as traders bet on a boom under President-elect Donald Trump.】

item.title: 混凝土行业下滑凸显新西兰经济颓势
item.description: 新西兰的混凝土产量滑落到九年来的最低水平，凸显出经济衰退导致的建筑业放缓。【原文：New Zealand’s concrete production slipped to the lowest level in nine years, highlighting a construction slowdown in a sputtering economy.】

item.title: 努里埃尔-鲁比尼说：特朗普的政策可能导致 "债券守夜人 "卷土重来
item.description: 努里埃尔-鲁比尼（Nouriel Roubini）说，唐纳德-特朗普重返美国总统宝座后，如果他继续推行大笔支出计划，"债券守夜人 "可能会重新出现。【原文：Donald Trump’s return to the US presidency could see the re-emergence of the “bond vigilantes” if he follows through with his big spending plans, Nouriel Roubini said.】

item.title: 即使特朗普给前景蒙上阴影，澳大利亚消费者信心指数仍在攀升
item.description: 尽管唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）在大选中获胜引发了一些不安，但由于家庭不再担心利率进一步上调的风险，澳大利亚 11 月份的消费者信心在上个月的基础上有所上升。【原文：Australia’s consumer confidence rose in November, building on last month’s gains as households are no longer concerned about the risk of further interest rate increases, though Donald Trump’s election victory caused some uneasiness.】

item.title: 受需求担忧和美元影响，石油保持两周来最大跌幅
item.description: 由于中国需求前景疲软、美元走强以及对市场可能转向供应过剩的担忧，石油创下两周来的最大跌幅。【原文：Oil held the biggest drop in two weeks on a soft demand outlook in China, a stronger US dollar, and concerns the market may flip to oversupply.】

item.title: 日本少数派政府可助零售股和公用事业股一臂之力
item.description: 反对党议员在日本新近形成的影响力让投资者开始关注零售商和发电企业的股票收益。【原文：The newfound influence of opposition lawmakers in Japan has investors looking for gains in the shares of retailers and electricity generators.】

item.title: 人才流失后香港金融业就业岗位反弹至创纪录水平
item.description: 随着银行和资产管理公司将赌注押在香港成为全球最大的财富管理中心上，香港的持牌金融工作岗位创下了历史新高。【原文：Hong Kong is recovering after a bruising talent drain, with licensed finance jobs hitting a record as banks and asset managers bet on the city’s push to become the world’s biggest wealth management hub.】

item.title: 交易商对印度企业漏报盈利处以更严厉处罚
item.description: 印度最大的涂料生产商是最新的受害者，因为紧张的投资者对未能达到盈利预期的股票变得更加无情。【原文：India’s largest paint maker is the latest victim of nervous investors turning more unforgiving of stocks failing to meet their earnings expectations.】

item.title: 对涉嫌黑客攻击雪花公司客户的指控解封
item.description: 对涉嫌对 Snowflake Inc.【原文：Charges were unsealed against two men suspected of carrying out cyberattacks against customers of Snowflake Inc., providing new details about the breaches.】

item.title: Grab 在季度盈利超过预期后上调了业绩预测
item.description: Grab Holdings Ltd.上调了今年的盈利预期，此前该公司的季度利润超过了预期，原因是该公司削减了成本，以应对东南亚打车和快递市场激烈竞争的影响。【原文：Grab Holdings Ltd. raised its earnings forecast for the year after quarterly profit topped estimates, helped by cost cuts to tackle the effects of intense competition in Southeast Asia’s ride-hailing and delivery markets.】

item.title: 特朗普交易势头强劲，亚洲投资者表现谨慎：市场综述
item.description: 美国股市连续第五个交易日上涨，比特币突破88,000美元，美元创下一年新高，因为投资者继续押注这些交易将受益于当选总统唐纳德-特朗普的议程。亚洲股市的开局较为谨慎。【原文：US stocks rose for a fifth straight session, while Bitcoin topped $88,000 and the dollar hit a one-year high as investors continued to bet those trades will benefit from President-elect Donald Trump’s agenda. Asian shares were set for a more cautious start.】

item.title: 银行家认为香港首次公开募股回暖将缓解亚洲交易荒
item.description: 在经历了几年的低迷之后，亚洲的银行家们看到了首次公开募股复苏的迹象。【原文：After a lean couple of years, bankers in Asia are seeing signs of a recovery in initial public offerings.】

item.title: 特朗普赢得大选后，Threads、Bluesky 用户激增
item.description: 自美国大选之夜以来，Threads 和 Bluesky 这两个与埃隆-马斯克的 X 非常相似的社交网络迎来了大量新用户，因为在唐纳德-特朗普赢得总统大选后，人们开始寻求马斯克的更右倾平台的替代品。【原文：Threads and Bluesky, rival social networks that look a lot like Elon Musk’s X, have seen an influx of new users since election night in the US as people seek alternatives to Musk’s more right-leaning platform following Donald Trump’s presidential victory.】

item.title: Interactive Brokers 创始人称预测市场提供 "理性 "答案
item.description: 零售经纪商互动经纪集团公司（Interactive Brokers Group Inc.【原文：Prediction markets have “enormous” growth potential, Thomas Peterffy, the billionaire founder of the retail brokerage Interactive Brokers Group Inc., said in the wake of the firm’s success during the US presidential election.】

item.title: 邻国解体，秘鲁准备应对玻利维亚移民潮
item.description: 秘鲁当局正密切关注邻国玻利维亚的情况，该国潜在的经济崩溃可能会引发新一轮的地区移民潮。【原文：Peruvian authorities are keeping a wary eye on conditions in neighboring Bolivia, where a potential economic collapse could unleash a new wave of regional migration.】

item.title: 巴西对冲基金 Verde 称在特朗普获胜前就已押注比特币
item.description: 由业内资深人士路易斯-斯图尔伯格（Luis Stuhlberger）经营的巴西资金管理公司Verde Asset Management是因当选总统唐纳德-特朗普重返白宫而引发的比特币反弹的参与者之一。【原文：Verde Asset Management, the Brazilian money manager run by industry veteran Luis Stuhlberger, is among those riding the Bitcoin rally sparked by President-elect Donald Trump’s return to the White House.】

item.title: 关注特朗普，债券投资者为收益率飙升做好准备
item.description: 美国国债开盘将走弱，因为投资者希望重燃唐纳德-特朗普上周赢得总统大选所引发的抛售潮。【原文：US Treasuries are set to open weaker as investors look to rekindle the selloff spurred by Donald Trump’s presidential victory last week.】

item.title: 厄瓜多尔诺沃亚在选举争端中将副总统扫地出门
item.description: 作为厄瓜多尔的政治障碍，丹尼尔-诺沃亚总统撤换了他的副手，而选举当局则在二月选举前取消了一位保守派候选人的资格。【原文：President Daniel Noboa removed his second-in-command as a political obstacle in Ecuador, while electoral authorities disqualified a conservative candidate ahead of February’s election.】

item.title: 前 Alameda 联合首席执行官 Sam Trabucco 向 FTX 债权人放弃游艇和公寓
item.description: 山姆-特拉布科（Sam Trabucco）是山姆-班克曼-弗里德（Sam Bankman-Fried）两年前在 FTX 和阿拉米达研究公司（Alameda Research）倒闭前的核心圈子成员之一，他已同意将包括游艇在内的一系列财产移交给这家倒闭的加密货币交易所的债权人。【原文：Sam Trabucco, one of Sam Bankman-Fried’s inner circle before the collapse the FTX and Alameda Research two years ago, has agree to hand over a slew of properties, including his yacht to creditors of the failed crypto exchange.】

item.title: 贝莱德推出新 ETF，瞄准货币市场基金业务
item.description: 贝莱德公司（BlackRock Inc.【原文：BlackRock Inc. is throwing its weight behind an early push to bring exchange-traded funds to money-market investors.】

item.title: 加拿大港口停工令特鲁多政府再次陷入困境
item.description: 商业团体敦促贾斯汀-特鲁多（Justin Trudeau）政府结束加拿大最大港口的劳资纠纷，就像 8 月份对铁路部门所做的那样，以避免国家供应链出现混乱。【原文：Business groups are urging Justin Trudeau’s government to put an end to labor strife at Canada’s largest ports, as it did with railways in August, to avoid chaos in the country’s supply chains.】

item.title: 特朗普获胜后，特斯拉拥趸全力推动 3,000 亿美元集会
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）当选总统后，特斯拉公司（Tesla Inc.由于投资者对特朗普的第二个任期将给埃隆-马斯克领导的电动汽车制造商带来暴利充满信心，特斯拉的股价攀升似乎势不可挡。【原文：Tesla Inc. fans have been reinvigorated by Donald Trump’s presidential triumph. The stock’s climb has been seemingly unstoppable as investors pile into the shares, confident that a second Trump term will bring windfalls to the Elon Musk-led electric vehicle maker.】
